items.title: Create Nested Comments
items.body:
Under resources/blog/single page I want the feature of nested comment i.e., it should contain nested replies.
![screenshot from 2017-10-17 02-22-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25401671/31634809-542b1dbc-b2e2-11e7-9536-bbd27bf6cc9b.png)

items.title: Add support for @Size bean validation annotation
items.body:
### 🆕🐥:dog: First Timers Only
This issue is reserved for people who never contributed to Open Source before. We know that the process of creating a pull request is the biggest barrier for new contributors. This issue is for you 💝 

### :space_invader: Description of the issue
Currently the `dolphin-platform-bean-validation` module do not provide support for all default bean validation annotations. One that is missing is the `@Size` annotation. For solving this issue the support for the `@ Size ` annotation must be added like it is done for several other bean validation annotations in the `dolphin-platform-bean-validation` module and at least one unit test must check that the annotation is supported.

### 📋 Step by Step
- 🙋 Claim this issue: Comment below.
- 🔄 replace the up for grabs label with in progress.
- :fork_and_knife: fork the repository in github by simply clicking the 'fork' button.
- :arrow_heading_down: check out the forked repository
- :twisted_rightwards_arrows: create a feature branch for the issue. We do not have any naming definition for branches.
- 💾 Commit your changes.
- 🔀 Start a Pull Request.
- 🏁 Done 👍 Ask in comments for a review :)
- 🔬 If the reviewer find some missing peaces or a problem he will start a discussion with you and describe the next steps how the problem can be solved.
- :boom: you did it! We will merge the fix in the master of the Dolphin Platform project.
- :bouquet: Thanks, thanks, thanks for being part as an open source contributor for Dolphin Platform

### 🤔❓ Questions
You can [join our community chat at Slack](https://join-dolphin-platform-slack.herokuapp.com/)

items.title: Create printable version with QR code
items.body: Create a printable version of the encrypted code after creation. Include a QR code which will source back to encrypt your wallet with the encryption key prefilled into the decryption page focused on the password field.

items.title: Need images for squirrels & acorns
Re-add save-prefix on .yarnrc
items.body: `save-prefix false`

items.title: Add Polish translations
items.body: Create a separate xml file just like given in the repo using the same keys and add corresponding translations for the english values.

items.title: Add Urdu translations
items.body: Create a separate xml file just like given in the repo using the same keys and add corresponding translations for the english values.

items.title: Create Sprite for Ice Axe
items.body:
**Please see CONTRIBUTING.md first.**

Happy Hacking! :smiley:

items.title: Proposal: Quick guide for ARMHF / ARM64
items.body:
This will be a quick guide showing:

* Deploying on ARMHF on Swarm
* Getting the CLI
* How to patch the templates

For ARM64 we'd show:

* How to deploy on Swarm
* How to patch the templates (includes Nodejs)

I suggest this is written by a maintainer or contributor.

items.title: Replace code in travis.yml
items.body:
Replace the [follow code](https://github.com/pynocchio/pynocchio/blob/develop/.travis.yml#L39):

```yml
  api_key:
     secure: 
```
by
```yml
api_key: $GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN
```
in `.travis.yml` file.

items.title: Fix #12 use yml extension for stylelint config
items.body:
From playing around with various hound configs, It seems that it requires a file extension to know that the contents are yaml, not json.

You can see an example PR which fails the stylelint check here: 
https://github.com/mileswilson/material/pull/5

Does this solve #12 ?

items.title: Crossposting button looks messed up whenever you hover over it
items.body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11031051/31633270-7d02bbec-b2c8-11e7-88a9-67cd559dd673.png)

items.title: Add Indonesian translations
items.body: Create a separate xml file just like given in the repo using the same keys and add corresponding translations for the english values.

items.title: Changing units does not update units on first click
items.body:
## What's the current situation?

1. Load a location: https://wxkb.io/10025
2. Click a different unit (`F°, mph` to `C°, mph`)
3. Units on page are not updated.
4. Clicking again on the button will update the values.

## What do you recommend?
Units should change and update the page on first click.

I think this is caused by `sw.js`. Recommend looking at: https://github.com/JulianNorton/weather-10kb/blob/master/public/sw-registration.js#L2

items.title: Form Component
items.body: Leaving this here as an addition to #4 if anyone wants to take it over.

items.title: Fix formatting of debug log overflow
items.body: Fixes #12087.

items.title: Add Filipino translations
items.body: Create a separate xml file just like given in the repo using the same keys and add corresponding translations for the english values.

items.title: remove 'members' section and add last & next meetup links
items.body: last & next meetup links can be hardcoded

items.title: Update Benelli M4 Sprite
items.body:
**Please see CONTRIBUTING.md first.**

**This is an _update_ issue**. This means that somebody has already created a sprite for this item. After a while, an _update_ issue is automatically generated for improvement purposes. You can either enhance the original sprite, or create one from scratch!

Reference sprite:
![Sprite](https://github.com/doficia/project-cordon-sprites/raw/master/sprites/weapons/benelli-m4.png)

Happy Hacking! :smiley:

items.title: Style selection problem
items.body:
If you select the same style a couple of times it doesn't load any CSS file.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6655009/31632366-fe9b63ea-b2bc-11e7-86fa-547f6d665260.png)

Additionally, I would suggest to set the opacity of <body> to 0 until a stylesheet is loaded and then soft transition to opacity: 1. This would remove the visible style change on page load.

items.title: Fix crash in shader parsing
items.body:
...that would happen if incorrect syntax was found just after an opening square bracket.

Fixes #12046.

items.title: Feature Request = Make Ponch Polite again
items.body:
This feature request is Beginners friendly:

We need a more Canadian Ponch, Everytime someone says "Thank you" he should reply something...

That something can be "You are welcome @{user}" or something equally polite :+1:

items.title: Operating system algorithms
items.body: I couldn't find any OS algorithms. They can probably be added too.
